channel.title: VERY basic html1 server
channel.description:
This was just a small project to 'learn' the basics of talking to a web browser in Java. Turns out it was far easier than I thought. This code is the result of a snippet I found online to send the favicon.ico file, then myself editing and changing the code to make it into a more basic web-server for HTML and file transfer only. I did make it on the horrible new thread-pre-connection style to make it operate a little faster because without the multi-threading it would only deal with one received connection at a time resulting in slow data transfers.
This only supports sending of HTML and files. If you try to use PHP code or anything where the file needs to be parsed server-sided then you will be sending plain text to the web-browser. There is currently no support for folders so as it sits without editing an entire website would need to be hosted in the root directory. Shouldn't be hard for anyone with basic java knowledge to fix.
Screenshot of CMD: [img]http://i.imgur.com/eFle54W.png[/img]
Download: http://upx.nz/cJeAug
Side notes: I send this out with no license as it was the result of a snippet I found online. Do with it what you will. I am not responsible if your computer does any of the following: [ul][li]Melts[/li] [li]Catches on fire[/li] [li]Blows up[/li] [li]Starts a national revolution[/li] [li]Bakes cupcakes[/li] [li]Commits mass murder[/li][/ul]

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Ambokile:

Yeah I’d be willing to submit a PR if you put it up on github

Migrated the project as the movie server. Will work as a good html/file server fine would just need minor edits to change how the folders get indexed into a page.

item.title: VERY basic html1 server
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

CoonHunter:

Would anybody be willing to help me fix an issue with it if I upload to git? I have made changes to turn it into a movie server. I can download movies just fine at around 2.5MB/s in-house on a MiFi box from straight talk (I got it free). When I attempt to watch them via an HTML5 embed they will not play when linking to my server but when linking to another file-server for the movie to play it works fine.

well yes, that’s the point. if you use git and upload it to github other users can literally post ‘issues’ about your software and also submit pull requests to fix things directly.

Read full topic

item.title: VERY basic html1 server
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:10, topic:554747”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=673670.msg4504729#msg4504729 date=1456052083]

why not github it

Why no github is because I don’t bother with 3rd party hosts and the fact I have to tether to my phone for any internet.

i think you’re confusing git with svn? git is decentralised so github could go down tomorrow and you’d still have the code, if that’s why you’re worried about “bothering with 3rd party hosts”. commits also stay local until you push, so you’d only push when you’re ready to connect to the internet. not gonna tell u how to live ur life m8 but I know if I had a poor internet connection i’d definitely be using git not a file sharing service.
[/quote]
Yes I know about git without confusion. Its just my preference to do things like this. Maybe one day things will change if I ever get back into doing serious programming work. Just have no need to git such a small 2 class project anyways.

Spending a bit today fixing file-transfering and checking if my browser on my chromebooks even support HTML5 video tags.[/quote]
not trying to be a dick but i’m still struggling to understand the reason for your preference. I understand it’s your opinion but what is it… just gut feeling? github repos are free and it takes like 2 seconds to create one, so i’m not sure why you think there’s too much overheard for a project of this size. surely you’re getting significantly more overhead zipping up your codebase and uploading it to uppit? if you want feedback from developers you should use the tools they use, and I don’t know any who would be happy having over 10 lines of code outside of version control.

Read full topic

item.title: VERY basic html1 server
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

If it’s the size of the project, perhaps http://gist.github.com would suffice. We’re only pushing you to use Github because no one wants to download an archive, extract it, etc.

I get a 404 for the download anyways…

Read full topic

item.title: VERY basic html1 server
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Ambokile:

why not github it

Why no github is because I don’t bother with 3rd party hosts and the fact I have to tether to my phone for any internet.

t4:

damn dude it’s already html5… way behind …

I’ve added folder support, and need to fix file transfer. The only reason I am continuing on doing this is simply to make a in-house movie streaming server. My chromebook for some reason wont do with any HTML5 streaming solutions so I will be looking for a SWF player that will play a linked MP4 file. Just need to fix the file-transfer first. Browser has no idea how much data it is downloading so ultimately it just fails.
